Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.progress

Interface ProgressReporter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Resettable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConcurrentProgress, Progress
    public interface ProgressReporter
extends Resettable
    Reports the progress of some operation to an end-user in some manner. The operation begins when start() is called and ends when end() is called. During the operation, each increment of progress can be reported with next() or next(Count). As the operation progresses, any ProgressListener that is registered via listener(ProgressListener) is called with the percent-complete.
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    Progress

      static ProgressReporter NULL
      A progress reporter that does nothing

      • end

      • end

        default void end()
        Report that the operation has ended

      • isIndefinite

        default boolean isIndefinite()
        Returns:
        True if progress is indefinite because the number of steps in not known

      • listener

        default ProgressReporter listener​(ProgressListener listener)
        Calls a listener with the percent of progress each time it changes. This method is only called if steps() is larger than 0.

      • next

        void next()
        Report the next step in the operation. This is often fine-grained such as processing a single node or way in a data file. The implementation in Progress of this interface is designed to be efficient in this way.

      • next

        default void next​(Count steps)
        Report progress of the given number of steps towards completion

      • next

        default void next​(int steps)
        Report progress of the given number of steps towards completion

      • phase

        default ProgressReporter phase​(java.lang.String phase)
        Parameters:
        phase - The phase of processing the same items multiple times, like "reading", "sorting", "saving"

      • start

        default ProgressReporter start()
        Report that the operation has begun

      • start

        default ProgressReporter start​(java.lang.String label)
        Report that the operation has begun

      • steps

        default ProgressReporter steps​(Count steps)
        Sets the number of steps that can be executed, allowing a calculation of absolute progress

      • steps

        default Count steps()
        The number of steps in the operation before it completes or null if it is indefinite
